Kīlamangala：1．Kīlamangala．-A district in South India which Lankāpura subdued and gave over to Mālava （Cv．lxxvi．209-11）．Its chieftain （nādālvāra） was Kulasekhara’s ally （Cv．lxxvii．80）．It was one of the two divisions of Mangala，the other being called Melamangala．



2．Kīlamangala．-A Damila chieftain，ally of Kulasekhara．Cv．lxxvii．80．
